text: Edwin Bowey was a male wrestler who competed for England and took part in the Olympic Games. ==Wrestling career== He competed in the 1948 Olympic Games. He represented England and won a bronze medal in the 60kg division at the 1950 British Empire Games in Auckland, New Zealand. ==Personal life== During the Games in 1950 he lived at George Crescent, Muswell Hill, London and was a horticulturist by trade. He emigrated to New Zealand the following year and worked as a lumberjack but later returned to England. ==References== Category:1928 births Category:English male wrestlers Category:Wrestlers at the 1950 British Empire Games Category:Possibly living people
title: Edwin Bowey
